It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant exhibits a unique life cycle, with its fronds rapidly developing and withering within a short period, often completing its reproductive cycle before being replaced. Due to its limited distribution and fragile nature, it is considered a sensitive indicator of environmental health.
